name: 1p1e2apr1

body.origin:
|- wceq(co(nat1, caddc, nat1), nat2)
-| wceq(nat2, co(nat1, caddc, nat1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(co(nat1, caddc, nat1), nat2)
-| wceq(nat2, co(nat1, caddc, nat1))

comment: One plus one equals two. Using proof-shortening techniques pioneered by Mr. Mel L. O'Cat, along with the latest supercomputer technology, Prof. Loof Lirpa and colleagues were able to shorten Whitehead and Russell's 360-page proof that 1+1=2 in _Principia Mathematica_ to this remarkable proof only two steps long, thus establishing a new world's record for this famous theorem. (Contributed by Prof. Loof Lirpa, 1-Apr-2008.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
